author: Jillian Stampher
title: Photo: Crews on scene after emergency slides are used to evacuate American Airlines plane at Dallas-Forth Worth Airport - @BTSullivan91
text: Emergency Slides Used to Evacuate American Airlines Plane at D/FW Airport Three suffer minor injuries as 141 passengers, crew of five are evacuated Emergency Slides Used to Evacuate American... Link Close Embed this video <script type="text/javascript" charset="UTF-8" src="http://www.nbcdfw.com/portableplayer/?cmsID=320147631&videoID=Y8Vr0ZyNGeX9&origin=nbcdfw.com&sec=news&subsec=local&width=600&height=360"></script> More videos (1 of 9) « » Emegency chutes were deployed on an American Airlines flight from Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport to Chicago Thursday before the plane left the terminal. (Published Thursday, July 30, 2015) Updated 36 minutes ago Three American Airlines passengers suffered minor injuries Thursday when they were evacuated via emergency slides moments before the jet was to pull away from the gate at Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport. American Airlines Flight 1658 to Chicago O'Hare International Airport was scheduled to leave Gate A14 at D/FW at 11:35 a.m. but was instead evacuated after smoke was reported in the cabin, according to an airline spokesperson. Clear the Shelters' in DFW by Adopting a Loving Pet At least five emergency exit doors were opened, including two emergency exits over the wing and an exit through the aircraft's tail. Inflatable slides at the passenger access door and a rear service door expedited the evacuation of all 141 passengers and the crew of five. "Our fleet service team was still on the ramp and assisted passengers and crew with a successful evacuation of the aircraft," AA Spokesperson Andrea Huguely said in a statement. Three people suffered minor injuries, airline officials said. American said they are working to get the passengers on another flight to Chicago. NBC 5 will update this story with more information as soon as it's available. As this story is developing, elements may change. Published 2 hours ago
